senses.sense_definition: A place where historical documents, records, or other media are kept and preserved.

examples.text: The researcher visited the national <w>archive</w> to examine the original treaty.
We spent the afternoon in the film <w>archive</w> looking for old footage.

senses.sense_definition: A collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place, institution, or group of people.

examples.text: The university holds a vast <w>archive</w> of letters written by famous authors.
She decided to donate her personal <w>archive</w> to the local library.

senses.sense_definition: Natural deposits of material, such as soil or ice, regarded as a record of environmental changes over time.

examples.text: Scientists analyzed the peat <w>archive</w> to understand ancient climate patterns.
This soil <w>archive</w> provides evidence of agricultural practices from centuries ago.

senses.sense_definition: To place documents, data, or materials into an archive for long-term storage or preservation.

examples.text: I need to <w>archive</w> these old emails to clear up space in my inbox.
The library plans to <w>archive</w> all local newspapers from the last century.
